author: Josh Mitchell
title: U.S. Factory Sector Activity Surges in February
text:
A key measure of U.S. factory-sector activity surged to the highest level since 2004 and raw-materials prices rose quickly, signs of an economy heating up.
The Institute for Supply Management, a trade group, said Thursday its index of manufacturing activity climbed 1.7 points from a month earlier to 60.8 in February. That marked the highest level since May 2004, near the height of the housing boom.
